description: This table holds global warming potentials (GWP) published in the IPCC Assessment reports.

sources.title: Reporting Requirements
sources.description: The  UNFCCC reporting guidelines on annual inventories for Parties included in Annex I to the Convention (Annex I Parties) require each Annex I Party [...] to provide its annual GHG inventory covering emissions and removals of direct GHGs (carbon dioxide (CO2), methane (CH4), nitrous oxide (N2O), perfluorocarbons (PFCs), hydrofluorocarbons (HFCs), sulphur hexafluoride (SF6) and nitrogen trifluoride (NF3)) [...].

fields.name: greenhouse_gas
fields.description: Name of the greenhouse gas given as common name, chemical name and/or industrial abbreviation

fields.name: gas_group
fields.description: Gas group a gas is belonging to. The gas groups were harmonized across the various IPCC Assessment Reports.

fields.name: chemical_formula
fields.description: Chemical formula of the respective greenhouse gas

fields.name: ipcc_report
fields.description: Source of the GWP value. AR1 meaning the First Assessment Report, AR2 the second Assessment Report etc.

fields.name: source
fields.description: Source table within the respective IPCC Assessment Report

fields.name: time_horizon
fields.description: Time horizon for which the GWP of a greenhouse gas was calculated. If unsure: a time horizon of 100 years is most commonly used.

fields.name: global_warming_potential
fields.description: Global warming potential of a greenhouse gas
fields.unit: kg CO2 equivalent per kg gas

fields.name: inequality_sign
fields.description: For some gases the Assessment Reports can only give lower or upper limits of the GWP values. In this case this column provides information whether the GWP is below or above a specific value.

fields.name: covered_by_unfccc
fields.description: This column indicates whether a specific gas is covered by the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC).

fields.name: covered_by_montreal_protocol
fields.description: This column indicates whether a specific gas is covered by the Montreal Protocol on Substances that Deplete the Ozone Layer.

fields.name: covered_by_eu_f_gas_regulation
fields.description: This column indicates whether a specific gas is covered by the EU F-gas regulation (Regulation (EU) No 517/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 16 April 2014 on fluorinated greenhouse gases and repealing Regulation (EC) No 842/2006).
